document.docAuthor: Ding, Yufeng, Ji, Ming & Chen, Jianxiu
document.docTitle: Folsomia nanjingensis Ding & Ji & Chen 2006, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Chinese Folsomia with a description of a new species (Collembola: Isotomidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Chinese Folsomia with a description of a new species (Collembola: Isotomidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
HOLOTYPE : female, China : Jiangsu Province : Nanjing ,
11­III­90
, collection number 8028, coll. Kenneth Christiansen.
PARATYPES : 3 females , 5 males and 1 juvenile , same data as holotype. Deposited in the Department of Biology , Nanjing University
.

The new species is easily distinguished from all the known species of the genus by the body sensilla as 3, 3/2, 2, 2, 3, 5, ommatidia 1+1, manubrium anterior setae as 2+2, ventral tube with 3+3 laterodistal setae, and other characters.
Color. Ground colour grey, eye patches violet.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Folsomia nanjingensis
sp. nov.
1. PAO and omma. 2. Groups of proximal, basomedial and postlabial setae. 3. Ant. I–III (only sensilla and basal microsensilla shown). 4. Body sensillar pattern and macrochaetotaxy (sensilla, microsensilla, macrosetae and p­row of setae shown). 5. Subcoxa of leg II. 6. Subcoxa of leg III.

FIGURES 7–13.
Folsomia nanjingensis
sp. nov.
7. Seta­like structures (from left to right: microsensillum, corner sensillum, common seta, macroseta of Th. II). 8. Ventral tube, lateral view. 9. Retinaculum, ventral view. 10. Anterior and posterior furcal subcoxa. 11. Furca, anterior view. 12. Furca, posterior view. 13. Male genital plate and peripheral setae.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology Name of the new species is derived from the type locality.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Comparison of
Folsomia nanjingensis
sp. nov. with other members in
quadrioculata
­ group.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The new species could be easily distinguished from all the known species of the genus by the body sensilla being 3, 3/2, 2, 2, 3, 5 and setae on anterior side of manubrium being 2+2. In accordance with Potapov (2001) , the new species should be placed in
quadrioculata
­group, with 17 species that all share the following characters: thoracic macrochaetotaxy as 1, 1 (except as 1, 2 in taimyrica Martynova, 1973,
regularis Hammer, 1953
and agrelli Gisin, 1944); microsensilla as 1, 0/1, 0, 0; corner sensillum present on each thoracic segment; medial sensillum on Abd I–III situated between Mac 1 and Mac 2; ommatidia as 0+0–2+2 and 2 ventral sensilla on Ant. I. The new species can be easily separated from other species in the
quadrioculata
­group by its particular body sensilla, setae on anterior face of manubrium and other characters shown in table 1 , excluding the 3 species mentioned above with thoracic macrosetae as 1, 2.
